hero.title: About Glodinas Finance B.V.
hero.subtitle: Your trusted partner for professional bookkeeping and financial services in the Netherlands.

company.title: Our Company
company.paragraph1: Glodinas Finance B.V. is a professional bookkeeping firm based in the Netherlands, dedicated to providing high-quality financial services to entrepreneurs and businesses.
company.paragraph2: We specialize in comprehensive bookkeeping solutions for ZZP'ers (self-employed professionals) and BVs (private limited companies), offering competitive rates starting at €130 per month (excluding VAT) for ZZP'ers and €250 per month (excluding VAT) for BVs, including DGA payroll administration.
company.paragraph3: Our mission is to help businesses maintain accurate financial records, comply with Dutch tax regulations, and make informed financial decisions to support their growth and success.

team.title: Our Team
team.subtitle: Meet the experts behind Glodinas Finance B.V.

member1.name: Cihat Kaya
member1.bio: With extensive experience in financial management and Dutch tax regulations, Cihat leads our team with expertise and dedication to client success.
member1.imageAlt: Cihat Kaya - Founder & CEO of Glodinas Finance

member2.name: Gabriel Stan
member2.bio: Gabriel helps clients navigate personal loan applications and financial planning, with strong relationships with major Dutch banks and financial institutions.
member2.imageAlt: Gabriel Stan - Financial Advisor at Glodinas Finance

member3.name: Ana Dogotari
member3.bio: Ana specializes in tax return preparation and compliance for Dutch companies, ensuring our clients meet all legal requirements and optimize their financial position.
member3.imageAlt: Ana Dogotari - Senior Accountant at Glodinas Finance

partners.title: Our Partners
partners.subtitle: We collaborate with trusted partners to deliver comprehensive financial solutions

partner1.name: Moneybird
partner1.description: We use Moneybird's intuitive accounting software to streamline our clients' financial administration.

partner2.name: Employes
partner2.description: Our partnership with Employes allows us to provide efficient and accurate payroll services for companies.

partner3.name: Firm24
partner3.description: Through our collaboration with Firm24, we offer comprehensive business formation services for entrepreneurs.

partners.bankingImageAlt: Dutch Banking Partners - ING, ABN AMRO, RABOBANK, SNS

cta.title: Ready to work with us?
cta.subtitle: Contact Glodinas Finance B.V. today to discuss how we can support your business's financial needs.

hero.title: Our Services
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive financial solutions for entrepreneurs and businesses in the Netherlands

bookkeepingZZP.title: Bookkeeping for ZZP'ers
bookkeepingZZP.description1: Our comprehensive bookkeeping service for self-employed professionals (ZZP'ers) starts at just €130 per month (excluding VAT).
bookkeepingZZP.description2: We handle all aspects of your financial administration using Moneybird, allowing you to focus on your core business activities.
items: Monthly bookkeeping and financial administration
VAT (BTW) return preparation and filing
Annual financial statements
Income tax return preparation
Ongoing financial advice and support

bookkeepingBV.title: Bookkeeping for BVs
bookkeepingBV.description1: Our bookkeeping service for private limited companies (BVs) starts at €150 per month (excluding VAT).
bookkeepingBV.description2: We provide comprehensive financial administration services tailored to the specific needs of Dutch BVs.
items: Monthly bookkeeping and financial administration
VAT (BTW) return preparation and filing
Annual financial statements
Corporate income tax return preparation
Director's salary administration
Dividend planning and administration

payroll.title: Payroll Services
payroll.description1: We offer efficient payroll services through our partnership with Employes, ensuring accurate and timely salary administration for your employees.
payroll.description2: Our payroll services help you comply with Dutch employment regulations and tax requirements.
items: Monthly salary calculations
Payslip generation and distribution
Tax and social security contributions
Annual statements and reporting
Leave and absence administration

businessFormation.title: Business Formation
businessFormation.description1: Through our partnership with Firm24, we offer comprehensive business formation services for entrepreneurs looking to establish their business in the Netherlands.
businessFormation.description2: We guide you through the entire process, from choosing the right business structure to registering with the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KVK).
items: Business structure consultation (ZZP, Eenmanszaak, BV)
Company name verification
Registration with the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KVK)
VAT registration
Notarial services for BV formation
Initial financial setup and administration

personalLoans.title: Personal Loan Assistance
personalLoans.description1: We provide assistance with personal loan applications at major Dutch banks, including ING, ABN AMRO, RABOBANK, and SNS.
personalLoans.description2: Our team helps you navigate the loan application process, ensuring you have the best chance of approval with favorable terms.
items: Loan options assessment based on your financial situation
Application preparation and documentation
Liaison with banking partners
Interest rate and term negotiation
Ongoing support throughout the approval process

taxPreparation.title: Tax Preparation
taxPreparation.description1: Our tax preparation services ensure that your business and personal tax filings are accurate, compliant, and optimized to minimize your tax burden.
taxPreparation.description2: We stay up-to-date with the latest Dutch tax regulations to provide you with expert advice and support.
items: Income tax return preparation for individuals
Corporate tax return preparation for businesses
VAT (BTW) return preparation and filing
Tax planning and optimization strategies
Representation in tax matters with the Dutch Tax Authority

pricing.title: Pricing Overview
pricing.subtitle: Transparent pricing for our core services

hero.title: Privacy Policy
hero.subtitle: How Glodinas Finance B.V. protects your personal data

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: Glodinas Finance B.V. ("we," "our," or "us"), located at Schiphol Boulevard 127, Schiphol 1118 BG, Netherlands, is committed to protecting your privacy and personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share, and safeguard your information when you use our services, visit our website www.glodinasfinance.nl, or otherwise communicate with us.
introduction.paragraph2: We process personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the Dutch Implementation Act GDPR. This policy describes your rights and our obligations regarding your personal data.

dataController.title: 2. Data Controller
dataController.paragraph: Glodinas Finance B.V. is the data controller for your personal data:
dataController.address: Address: Schiphol Boulevard 127, Schiphol 1118 BG, Netherlands

personalData.title: 3. Personal Data We Collect
personalData.paragraph: We collect and process the following categories of personal data:

clientData.title: 3.1 Client Data
items: Identity data: name, title, date of birth, gender, nationality
Contact data: email address, telephone number, physical address
Business data: company name, position, business sector, KVK number, VAT number
Financial data: bank account details, tax identification numbers, financial statements, income data, expense records
Service data: information about the services you use, account settings, preferences
Communication data: emails, letters, telephone conversations, and other communications with us

websiteVisitorData.title: 3.2 Website Visitor Data
items: Technical data: IP address, browser type and version, time zone setting, browser plug-in types and versions, operating system and platform
Usage data: information about how you use our website, products, and services
Cookie data: information stored in cookies (see our Cookie Policy for details)
Contact form data: information you provide when using our contact forms

employeeData.title: 3.3 Employee and Contractor Data
employeeData.paragraph: For our employees and contractors, we collect additional personal data necessary for employment or contractual relationships. This data is processed in accordance with our internal HR privacy policy.

purposesOfProcessing.title: 4. Purposes of Processing
purposesOfProcessing.paragraph: We process your personal data for the following purposes:
items: To provide our bookkeeping and financial services
To manage our relationship with you, including notifying you about changes to our services or terms
To administer and protect our business and website
To deliver relevant website content and advertisements to you
To use data analytics to improve our website, products/services, marketing, customer relationships, and experiences
To make suggestions and recommendations to you about services that may be of interest to you
To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

legalBasis.title: 5. Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.paragraph: We process your personal data on the following legal grounds:
items: Performance of a contract: Processing necessary for the performance of a contract with you or to take steps at your request before entering into a contract
Legal obligation: Processing necessary for compliance with our legal obligations
Legitimate interests: Processing necessary for our legitimate interests or those of a third party, except where such interests are overridden by your interests or fundamental rights and freedoms
Consent: Processing based on your consent
legalBasis.paragraph2: Where we rely on consent as a legal basis, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time by contacting us using the details provided in this policy.

dataSharing.title: 6. Sharing Your Personal Data
dataSharing.paragraph: We may share your personal data with the following categories of recipients:
items: Service providers who provide IT, system administration, and platform services
Professional advisers including lawyers, bankers, auditors, and insurers
Tax and customs authorities, regulators, and other authorities
Third parties to whom we may choose to sell, transfer, or merge parts of our business or our assets
dataSharing.paragraph2: We require all third parties to respect the security of your personal data and to treat it in accordance with the law. We do not allow our third-party service providers to use your personal data for their own purposes and only permit them to process your personal data for specified purposes and in accordance with our instructions.

internationalTransfers.title: 7. International Transfers
internationalTransfers.paragraph1: We primarily process your personal data within the European Economic Area (EEA). However, some of our service providers may be based outside the EEA, which means their processing of your personal data will involve a transfer of data outside the EEA.
internationalTransfers.paragraph2: Whenever we transfer your personal data out of the EEA, we ensure a similar degree of protection is afforded to it by implementing appropriate safeguards, such as using standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission.

dataSecurity.title: 8. Data Security
dataSecurity.paragraph1: We have implemented appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used, or accessed in an unauthorized way, altered, or disclosed.
dataSecurity.paragraph2: We limit access to your personal data to those employees, agents, contractors, and other third parties who have a business need to know. They will only process your personal data on our instructions, and they are subject to a duty of confidentiality.
dataSecurity.paragraph3: We have procedures in place to deal with any suspected personal data breach and will notify you and any applicable regulator of a breach where we are legally required to do so.

dataRetention.title: 9. Data Retention
dataRetention.paragraph1: We will only retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes we collected it for, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.
dataRetention.paragraph2: To determine the appropriate retention period for personal data, we consider the amount, nature, and sensitivity of the personal data, the potential risk of harm from unauthorized use or disclosure of your personal data, the purposes for which we process your personal data, and whether we can achieve those purposes through other means, and the applicable legal requirements.
dataRetention.paragraph3: For tax and accounting purposes, we typically retain client data for 7 years after the end of our business relationship, as required by Dutch law.

yourRights.title: 10. Your Rights
yourRights.paragraph: Under the GDPR, you have various rights regarding your personal data, including:
items: Right to access: You can request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
Right to rectification: You can request correction of any inaccurate personal data we hold about you.
Right to erasure: You can request that we delete your personal data in certain circumstances.
Right to restrict processing: You can request that we restrict the processing of your personal data in certain circumstances.
Right to data portability: You can request the transfer of your personal data to you or to a third party in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format.
Right to object: You can object to our processing of your personal data in certain circumstances.
Right to withdraw consent: Where we rely on your consent to process your personal data, you can withdraw this at any time.
yourRights.paragraph2: To exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the details provided in this policy. We may need to request specific information from you to help us confirm your identity and ensure your right to access your personal data (or to exercise any of your other rights).

cookies.title: 11. Cookies
cookies.paragraph1: Our website uses cookies to distinguish you from other users of our website. This helps us to provide you with a good experience when you browse our website and also allows us to improve our site.
cookies.paragraph2: For detailed information on the cookies we use and the purposes for which we use them, see our Cookie Policy.

changes.title: 12. Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.paragraph: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated "Last updated" date at the top of this privacy policy. We encourage you to review this privacy policy frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.

contact.title: 13. Contact Us
contact.paragraph1: If you have any questions about this privacy policy or our privacy practices, please contact us at:

complaints.title: 14. Complaints
complaints.paragraph1: If you have a complaint about our use of your personal data, please contact us first, and we will do our best to resolve the issue.
complaints.paragraph2: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the Dutch Data Protection Authority (Autoriteit Persoonsgegevens) if you are not satisfied with our response or believe we are not processing your personal data in accordance with the law.

hero.title: Terms of Service
hero.subtitle: Terms and conditions for using Glodinas Finance B.V. services

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern your use of the services provided by Glodinas Finance B.V. ("we," "our," or "us"), a company registered in the Netherlands with Chamber of Commerce (KVK) number 81805810, located at Schiphol Boulevard 127, Schiphol 1118 BG.
introduction.paragraph2: By engaging our services or using our website www.glodinasfinance.nl, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, please do not use our services or website.

services.title: 2. Services
services.paragraph1: Glodinas Finance B.V. provides bookkeeping, financial administration, and related services to businesses and individuals in the Netherlands.
services.paragraph2: The specific services to be provided will be agreed upon in a separate service agreement or engagement letter between you and Glodinas Finance B.V.
services.paragraph3: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any part of our services at any time, with or without notice.

clientResponsibilities.title: 3. Client Responsibilities
clientResponsibilities.paragraph: As a client of Glodinas Finance B.V., you agree to:
items: Provide accurate, complete, and timely information necessary for us to perform our services
Respond promptly to our requests for information or clarification
Review any documents, reports, or filings we prepare on your behalf and notify us of any errors or concerns
Pay our fees as agreed in the service agreement or engagement letter
Comply with all applicable laws and regulations related to your business and financial activities
Maintain the confidentiality of any login credentials we provide for accessing financial software or platforms

fees.title: 4. Fees and Payment
fees.paragraph1: Our fees for services are as specified in the service agreement or engagement letter between you and Glodinas Finance B.V.
fees.paragraph2: Unless otherwise agreed, invoices are due within 14 days of the invoice date. Late payments may be subject to interest charges at the statutory rate under Dutch law.
fees.paragraph3: We reserve the right to suspend services if payment is not received within the agreed timeframe.
fees.paragraph4: All fees are exclusive of VAT (BTW), which will be added at the applicable rate.

termination.title: 5. Termination
termination.paragraph1: Either party may terminate the service agreement by providing written notice as specified in the service agreement or engagement letter.
termination.paragraph2: Upon termination, you agree to pay for all services rendered up to the date of termination.
termination.paragraph3: We reserve the right to terminate services immediately if:
items: You breach these Terms or the service agreement
You fail to provide necessary information or cooperation
You engage in illegal or unethical activities
We are required to do so by law or professional standards

confidentiality.title: 6. Confidentiality
confidentiality.paragraph1: We will maintain the confidentiality of all information you provide to us in connection with our services, except as required by law or professional standards.
confidentiality.paragraph2: We may disclose your information to third parties as necessary to provide our services, such as to tax authorities or software providers, but only to the extent necessary.
confidentiality.paragraph3: Our full privacy practices are described in our Privacy Policy, which is incorporated into these Terms by reference.

intellectualProperty.title: 7. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.paragraph1: All intellectual property rights in our services, website, and materials remain the property of Glodinas Finance B.V. or our licensors.
intellectualProperty.paragraph2: You may use materials we provide to you solely for your own business purposes and may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without our prior written consent.

limitation.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
limitation.paragraph1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Glodinas Finance B.V. shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or any loss of profits or revenues, whether incurred directly or indirectly, or any loss of data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses.
limitation.paragraph2: Our total liability for any claims arising under these Terms or the service agreement shall not exceed the amount paid by you to us for the services giving rise to the claim in the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to the liability.
limitation.paragraph3: Nothing in these Terms shall limit or exclude our liability for:
items: Death or personal injury caused by our negligence
Fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation
Any liability that cannot be excluded or limited by Dutch law

indemnification.title: 9. Indemnification
indemnification.paragraph: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Glodinas Finance B.V. and our officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and costs, arising out of or in any way connected with your use of our services or your violation of these Terms.

force.title: 10. Force Majeure
force.paragraph: We shall not be liable for any failure or delay in performing our obligations where such failure or delay results from any cause beyond our reasonable control, including but not limited to, acts of God, natural disasters, pandemic, epidemic, government actions, war, terrorism, civil unrest, labor disputes, or the failure of third-party service providers.

governing.title: 11. Governing Law and Jurisdiction
governing.paragraph1: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Netherlands.
governing.paragraph2: Any dispute arising out of or in connection with these Terms or our services shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

severability.title: 12. Severability
severability.paragraph: If any provision of these Terms is found to be unenforceable or invalid under any applicable law, such unenforceability or invalidity shall not render these Terms unenforceable or invalid as a whole, and such provisions shall be deleted without affecting the remaining provisions.

entire.title: 13. Entire Agreement
entire.paragraph1: These Terms, together with the service agreement or engagement letter and our Privacy Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and Glodinas Finance B.V. regarding our services and supersede all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals, or representations, written or oral.
entire.paragraph2: No modification of these Terms shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed by an authorized representative of Glodinas Finance B.V.

contact.title: 14. Contact Us
contact.paragraph: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us at:

footer.copyright: © 2025 Glodinas Finance B.V. All rights reserved.

hero.title: Getting Started with Glodinas Finance
hero.subtitle: Follow our simple three-step process to get your bookkeeping set up and running smoothly.

process.title: Our Onboarding Process
process.subtitle: We've designed a streamlined process to get you up and running quickly

step1.title: Sign Up for Moneybird
step1.description: Start by signing up for Moneybird using our referral link. This cloud-based bookkeeping software will be the foundation of your financial administration.
items: Create your Moneybird account
Add Glodinas Finance as your bookkeeper
Complete your basic company information

step2.title: Schedule a Setup Meeting
step2.description: Book a setup meeting with our team to configure your administration. We offer both in-person and remote TeamViewer sessions for your convenience.
items: Pay the one-time setup fee (€150 ex VAT)
Choose between in-person or TeamViewer session
We'll set up bank connections, client database, and invoice structure

step3.title: Select Your Subscription
step3.description: Choose the subscription plan that fits your business needs. We offer tailored packages for both ZZP'ers and BVs.
items: ZZP Bookkeeping: €130/month (ex VAT)
BV Bookkeeping: €150/month (ex VAT)
Automatic billing for hassle-free service

expectations.title: What to Expect
expectations.subtitle: Here's what happens after you complete our onboarding process

item1.title: Immediate Setup
item1.description: Your bookkeeping system will be fully configured and ready to use within 24-48 hours after your setup meeting.

item2.title: Ongoing Support
item2.description: You'll receive continuous support from our team to ensure your bookkeeping runs smoothly and efficiently.

item3.title: Monthly Updates
item3.description: Receive regular updates on your financial status, ensuring you always have a clear picture of your business finances.

item4.title: Tax Compliance
item4.description: We ensure your business remains compliant with all Dutch tax regulations and filing requirements.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about our onboarding process

questions.question: How long does the setup process take?
questions.answer: The entire onboarding process typically takes 2-3 business days from initial signup to complete setup. The setup meeting itself usually lasts about 1-2 hours.

questions.question: Do I need to prepare anything for the setup meeting?
questions.answer: Yes, please have your bank account login details, business registration information, and any existing client/invoice data ready for the setup meeting. This will help us configure your system efficiently.

questions.question: Can I switch from another bookkeeping service?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We can help you transition from your current bookkeeping service to our system. We'll guide you through the process of transferring your financial data and ensuring a smooth transition.

questions.question: What if I need help after the initial setup?
questions.answer: Our support doesn't end after setup. You'll have ongoing access to our team for any questions or assistance you need. We're just a phone call or email away.

questions.question: Is there a minimum contract period?
questions.answer: Our standard subscription is month-to-month with no long-term commitment required. You can cancel at any time with 30 days' notice.

cta.title: Ready to Get Started?
cta.subtitle: Start your journey with Glodinas Finance today and experience hassle-free financial management.
